title: Community detection tutorial
text:
Description
This is a modeling tutorial for the supplement for Miller-ter Kuile et al. “Accounting for imperfect detection to reveal the importance of current and past environmental conditions for long-term community stability”. in revision
The purpose of this tutorial is to provide a detailed description of the modeling approaches used in the paper.

title: 1  Accounting for imperfect detection
text:
Accounting for imperfect detection using Bayesian multi-species model (for either count or detection/non-detection)
[look in supporting info for more]

title: 2  Computing indices of community stability
text:
Measured community change (“stability”) through time
change in species presence/absence
or change in BC dissimilarity
calculated posterior means and SD values for each change metric for each site and year
used posterior means and standard deviation values in part 3
crumbs: 2  Computing indices of community stability

title: 3  Evaluating community stability in relation to environmental variables
text:
compiled abiotic and biotic variables that could influence community change
Determine whether responses to abiotic and biotic factors are instantaneous or lagged using Bayesian regression with stochastic antecedent modeling
model structure
crumbs: 3  Evaluating community stability in relation to environmental variables

title: 4  How imperfect detection shapes community change estimates across datasets
text:
assessed how accounting for imperfect detection influenced estimates of community change by comparing observed and modeled estimates of dissimilarity
first creating observed dataset based on multiple sampling events per year
then created an observed dataset based on one sampling event per year
examined differences between observed datasets by using Bayesian hierarchical regression with change as response and data derivation crossed with dataset as predictor
post-hoc pairwise tests to determine direction and magnitude of differences
crumbs: 4  How imperfect detection shapes community change estimates across datasets
